Travel Guide & Tips à®ªà®¯à®£ à®µà®´à®¿à®•à®¾à®Ÿà¯à®Ÿà®¿ & à®•à¯à®±à®¿à®ªà¯à®ªà¯à®•à®³à¯

History & Significance à®µà®°à®²à®¾à®±à¯ & à®šà®¿à®±à®ªà¯à®ªà¯

Chidambaram Thillai Nataraja Temple represents the Sky element (Akasha Lingam). It is famous for the 'Chidambara Rahasiyam' and the cosmic dance of Lord Shiva. Chidambaram Thillai Nataraja Temple represents the Sky element (Akasha Lingam). It is famous for the 'Chidambara Rahasiyam' and the cosmic dance of Lord Shiva.

Dress Code à®†à®Ÿà¯ˆ à®•à®Ÿà¯à®Ÿà¯à®ªà¯à®ªà®¾à®Ÿà¯

Men must remove shirts/vests to enter the inner sanctum. Men must remove shirts/vests to enter the inner sanctum.

Pro Tips for First-Timers à®®à¯à®•à¯à®•à®¿à®¯ à®•à¯à®±à®¿à®ªà¯à®ªà¯à®•à®³à¯

  • Witness the Spatika Linga Puja at 10 AM.
  • Visit the Pichavaram Mangrove Forest nearby (15km).
  • The temple architecture represents the human body structure.
  • Dikshitars are the hereditary priests here.
